intro: Wendlandia longipedicellata, commonly known as the pink wendlandia, is a striking flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners in temperate climates.
